    VALUES SYSTOOLS.GETENV('MY_ENVVAR');

-- Description: Set the value of MY_ENVVAR for the current job. 
    VALUES SYSTOOLS.PUTENV('MY_ENVVAR', 'My job''s value for the environment variable');

-- Description: Configure SELF to capture detail for all jobs started in the future, 
     -- for any SQL statements that fail with SQLCODE = -913 or SQLCODE = -204. 
  CREATE OR REPLACE VARIABLE SYSIBMADM.SELFCODES  
      VARCHAR(256) DEFAULT '-913, -204';

-- Description: Examine some statistical information for all members of all files in APPLIB1. 
 SELECT TABLE_NAME, NUMBER_ROWS, NUMBER_DELETED_ROWS, LAST_USED_TIMESTAMP 
  FROM QSYS2.SYSMEMBERSTAT 
  WHERE TABLE_SCHEMA = 'APPLIB1';

-- Description: Unlink file /usr/reportdata.txt. 
   VALUES SYSTOOLS.IFS_UNLINK(PATH_NAME => '/usr/reportdata.txt');

-- Description: Compare the names for all objects in two subtrees. Compare recursively  
        -- through the entire set of subdirectories. 
   SELECT * FROM TABLE(QSYS2.COMPARE_IFS(  
                                       START_PATH_NAME1    => '/usr/files.dir',  
                                       START_PATH_NAME2    => '/usrbackup/files.dir', 
                                       SUBTREE_DIRECTORIES => 'YES', 
                                       COMPARE_ATTRIBUTES  => 'NAMES' 
                              ));

-- Description: Remove an authentication entry for a specific user of an external interface.
VALUES SYSTOOLS.REMOVE_VALIDATION_LIST_ENTRY( 
                             VALIDATION_LIST_LIBRARY => 'APPLIB',  
                             VALIDATION_LIST_NAME    => 'APPVLDL', 
                             VALIDATION_USER         => 'my application user name');

-- Description: Find and end all the active jobs with a job name of BATCHTEST. 
    -- For every job, end using the controlled option, save any spooled files, and do 
    -- not generate a job log. 
  CALL SYSTOOLS.END_JOBS(JOB_NAME_FILTER          => 'BATCHTEST',  
                       END_OPTION               => 'CONTROLLED', 
                       DELETE_SPOOLED_FILES     => 'NO', 
                       MAXIMUM_JOBLOG_ENTRIES   => 0);

-- Description: List all the scheduled power events. 
  SELECT * FROM SYSTOOLS.POWER_SCHEDULE_INFO;

-- Description: List the status of all controllers. 
   SELECT OBJECT_NAME, OBJECT_ATTRIBUTE, STATUS_DESCRIPTION, TEXT_DESCRIPTION  
  FROM SYSTOOLS.CONFIGURATION_STATUS 
  WHERE OBJECT_TYPE = '*CTLD';

-- Description: Show information about the service tools server configuration. 
   SELECT * FROM QSYS2.SERVICE_TOOLS_SERVER_INFO;

-- Description: Review the Network Server password failures, by day and by server name. 
  SELECT DATE(ENTRY_TIMESTAMP) AS "DATE", SERVER_NAME,  
       COUNT(*) AS NETWORK_SERVER_PASSWORD_ERROR_COUNT 
  FROM TABLE (  
      SYSTOOLS.AUDIT_JOURNAL_VP(STARTING_TIMESTAMP => CURRENT TIMESTAMP - 7 DAYS))  
  GROUP BY DATE(ENTRY_TIMESTAMP), SERVER_NAME 
  ORDER BY "DATE", NETWORK_SERVER_PASSWORD_ERROR_COUNT DESC;

-- Description: Estimate the length of time required to complete                                   
-- synchronization of objects in a IBM i Migrate While                                              
-- Active environment to the copy node.                                                             
    SELECT * FROM TABLE(QSYS2.ESTIMATE_FINAL_SYNCHRONIZATION_TIME());

-- Description: Examine the integrated file system objects that are                                
-- currently attempting migration to the copy node.                                                 
    SELECT PATH_NAME, OBJECT_TYPE                                                                   
      FROM QSYS2.IFS_MIGRATION_LIST                                                                 
      WHERE TRACKING_STATE = 'MIGRATING'                                                          
      ORDER BY PATH_NAME, OBJECT_TYPE;

-- Description: Examine the eligible library-based objects that need                               
-- to be migrated to the copy node.                                                                 
    SELECT LIBRARY_NAME, OBJECT_NAME, OBJECT_SIZE                                                   
      FROM QSYS2.LIBRARY_MIGRATION_LIST                                                             
      WHERE TRACKING_STATE  <> 'MIGRATING'                                                        
      ORDER BY LIBRARY_NAME, OBJECT_NAME;

-- Description: Review a list of the integrated file system objects that                           
-- have successfully completed migration to the copy node within                                    
-- the last hour.                                                                                   
    SELECT * FROM QSYS2.MIGRATED_IFS                                                                
      WHERE MIGRATION_END_TIME > CURRENT TIMESTAMP - 1 HOUR                                         
      ORDER BY MIGRATION_END_TIME DESC;

-- Description: Review a list of library-based objects in TOYSTORE                                 
-- that have successfully completed migration to the copy node                                      
-- within the last hour.                                                                            
    SELECT * FROM QSYS2.MIGRATED_LIBRARY                                                            
      WHERE MIGRATION_END_TIME > CURRENT TIMESTAMP - 1 HOUR AND                                     
            (LIBRARY_NAME = 'TOYSTORE' OR                                                         
             (LIBRARY_NAME = 'QSYS' AND                                                           
              OBJECT_NAME = 'TOYSTORE' AND                                                        
              OBJECT_TYPE = '*LIB'))                                                              
      ORDER BY MIGRATION_END_TIME DESC;

-- Description: Check the bandwidth to the copy node in a IBM i                                    
-- Migrate While Active environment. Take the measurement 5                                         
-- times for calculating the values.                                                                
    SELECT * FROM TABLE(QSYS2.MIGRATION_NETWORK_BANDWIDTH(5));

-- Description: Determine whether the invoker of the function has read access to 
        --   /usr/reportdata.txt. 
   VALUES SYSTOOLS.IFS_ACCESS(PATH_NAME => '/usr/reportdata.txt',  
                           READ => 'YES');
